paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: The paper discusses the TTR gene and its mutations, particularly TTR-A and TTR-D, in the context of amyloidosis and their effects on cellular toxicity.

individual_records.phenotype_details: familial amyloid polyneuropathy with sensory and motor deficits
individual_records.evidence_sentence: The patient presented with symptoms consistent with familial amyloid polyneuropathy.

individual_records.phenotype_details: familial amyloid polyneuropathy with autonomic dysfunction
individual_records.evidence_sentence: The patient exhibited autonomic dysfunction indicative of familial amyloid polyneuropathy.
Despite being a carrier, the individual remains asymptomatic.

functional_data.summary: TTR-A and TTR-D mutants were shown to induce cell death in vitro, with SAP providing protective effects.

variants.segregation_data: The TTR variant segregates with disease in families.
variants.additional_notes: The study utilized a Drosophila model to assess the effects of TTR mutations.
key_quotes: Overexpression of mutated TTR leads to a neurological phenotype.
SAP prevents cell death induced by mutant TTR.

individual_records.phenotype_details: familial amyloid polyneuropathy with significant motor impairment
individual_records.evidence_sentence: The patient showed significant motor impairment consistent with familial amyloid polyneuropathy.
This individual is a carrier but has not developed any symptoms.

functional_data.summary: TTR-D and TTR-A mutants were shown to induce cell death in vitro, with SAP providing protective effects.

variants.segregation_data: The TTR variant segregates with disease in families.
variants.additional_notes: The study utilized a Drosophila model to assess the effects of TTR mutations.
key_quotes: Overexpression of mutated TTR leads to a neurological phenotype.
SAP prevents cell death induced by mutant TTR.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data was extracted from the main text.
